wrap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
wrap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The present was beautifully wrapped in gold paper.
Ella wrapped a thick coat around her shoulders.
He wrapped a bandage around my injured wrist.
I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
wrap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if you wrap your arms, legs, or fingers around something, you use them to hold it
wrap.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He wrapped his arms around her waist.
wrap.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders
wrap.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a type of thin clear plastic that is used to cover food
wrap.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a type of sandwich made with thin bread which is rolled around meat, vegetables etc
wrap.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the end of a day’s filming
